description: Redevelopment of the site to provide a part three and part four storey building (Block A) fronting Witley Gardens containing 2 x 1 bed flats, 19 x 2 bed flats, 4 x 3 bed flats and flexible 131sqm commercial floor space (A1, A2, A3 and B1 Use Classes) and a five storey building (Block B) fronting the Grand Union Canal containing 9 x 1 bed flats, 17 x 2 bed flats, 5 x 3 bed flats and a flexible 175sqm commercial floor space (A1, A2, A3 and B1 Use Classes) at ground level (56 residential units and 2 commercial units totalling 306sqm in total), the provision of 35 car parking spaces (6 disabled spaces) with access via Witley Gardens, integrated refuse and cycle storage spaces, private amenity spaces and public amenity space
decision_conditions: Time Limit
The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| Approved Plans

The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) Ground Floor Plan D3100/08; First Floor Plan D3101/05; Second Floor Plan D3102/05; Third Floor Plan D3103/05; Fourth Floor Plan D3104/05; Roof Plan D3105/05; Typical Flat Layouts D3250/02; Typical Flat Layouts D3251/02; Wheelchair Layouts D3301/02; Long Elevations D3700/04; Elevations GG / HH D3730/04; Elevations JJ / KK D3731/04; Detail Elevations Block B D3751/03; View 2 D3851/02; View 3 D3852/03 (all received 07/06/2016); 1366-D3720/02 Elevations CC/DD; Elevations EE/FF 1366-D3721/02; and Detail Elevations Block A 1366-D3750/01 (all received 06/01/2016)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| Materials

Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 1.1, 2.1 and 2.10 of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 DPD (2012); policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016 as amended);  and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Refuse and recycling storage areas
Refuse and recycling storage areas indicated on the approved plans shall be provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2015) policy 5.16.
| Accessibility
At least 90% of residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to the Lifetime Homes Standards, and at least six of the residential units shall be constructed to Wheelchair Housing Standards.

Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers/users, in accordance with the Mayor of London's Housing Standards Transition Statement (May 2015), policies 3.8 and 7.2 of The London Plan (2015) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Construction Management

Notwithstanding any information submitted, a finalised Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The plan shall include the following:
o	Construction traffic management proposals including details of delivery routes and HGV movements and details of any temporary site access/parking;
o	Details of construction hours;
o	Noise mitigation and monitoring measures;
o	Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials;
o	Details of temporary lighting;
o	Dust suppression, fumes and monitoring measures, having regard to GLA guide 'Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition';
o	Wheel wash measures;
o	Site security during construction;

o	A drainage strategy to operate setting out controls of contamination, including controls to surface water run-off, water pumping, storage of fuels and hazardous materials, spill response plans and pollution control measures; and
o	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.

The Construction Logistics Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policies 6.3 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2015 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan.
| Cycle Parking

The provision of at least 116 cycle parking spaces shown on the approved plans shall be provided to the specifications and adopted standards of the London Plan. This provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.
Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2016.
| Vehicle Parking Arrangements

The vehicle parking arrangements shown on the approved plans shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose. No additional car parking shall be formed or made available except with the prior permission of the local planning authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision within the site and to ensure that excessive parking is not provided, in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016); and section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Electric Vehicle Charging Points

At least seven vehicle parking spaces shown on the approved plans shall be provided for electric vehicle charging points. At least three of these parking spaces shall provide active charging points; and the other parking spaces shall be provided with passive charging provision. These shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the approved development.

Reason: In the interest of the environment and improving air quality in accordance with policies 6.13 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2015; policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(k) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
| Travel Plan

A green travel plan designed to manage the transport needs of residents, staff and visitors to minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is occupied. The Travel Plan shall include provisions for monitoring review and enforcement and shall be implemented at the time of first occupation of any part of the development and shall be permanently retained in operation for the life of the development.

Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport, and to limit the impact of the proposal on local parking and highway conditions, in accordance with policies 6.2, 6.4, 6.9, 6.10, 6.11, 6.13 of the London Plan (2015), Policies 1.1, 1.2, 3.1, 3.4 and 6.4 of the Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policy 6.13 of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD.
| Sustainability

Prior to first occupation of the development, the approved development shall incorporate sustainability measures as detailed in the approved Sustainability Statement Rev 0 prepared by Metropolis Green in 30 August 2015.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2015, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
| Water Efficiency
The development shall be designed to achieve a water consumption target of no more than 105 litres/person/day and shall incorporate rainwater harvesting technology used for landscape areas.
Reason: To ensure the sustainable use of water, in accordance with policy 5.15 of the London Plan 2016.
| Dynamic Overheating Analysis

Prior to the first occupation of the development, the approved development shall incorporate measures, as stated within the Energy Statement prepared by Metropolis Green in 11 January 2016, that will assist all dwellings and commercial areas to pass or exceed all criteria of CISBE Guide TM52/TM49 in line with the Summertime Overheating Analysis prepared by Metropolis Green in 4 March 2016.
Reason: To ensure that the risk of overheating has been sufficiently addressed in accordance with policy 5.9 of the London Plan (2016).
| Energy & CO2

Prior to the final completion of the development (including residential and commercial), the approved development shall incorporate measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 35.1% (equal to at least 29.3 tonnes CO2 per annum) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Energy Statement (11 January 2016), Efficient Baseline_01.03.2016, Renewable Baseline_01.03.2016, Efficient & Renewable baseline_brukl_07.01.2016, LBE Energy Statement Appendix B PV_Revised, 1366 - Witley Gardens, Southall, Schedule of Response to Ealing's Energy Comments_March2016 , 1366 - Witley Gardens Southall Schedule of Response to Ealing's Energy Comments_May2016, all prepared by Metropolis Green:
a)         energy saving measures to achieve at least 10.3% (equal to 8.6 tonnesCO2 per annum) in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings over the compliant BR Part L 2013 baseline

b)         incorporation of solar PV technology with a total capacity of 45.95kWp to achieve at least a percentage of 27.5% (equal to 20.6 tonnes C02 per annum) in carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings over the Be Lean case.

Within three-months of the first occupation of the new dwellings, Energy Performance Certificates, Accompany Advisory Reports and detailed SAP modelling output reports showing clearly the DER and TER for each unit from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

Reason:  To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2015 (with FALP 2011/REMA 2013), policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
| Details of Hard and Soft Landscaping and Boundary Treatment

Notwithstanding any information submitted, prior to the occupation of the development a revised master plan for the landscape scheme, full details of hard and soft landscaping works (including any furniture), boundary treatments (including a phased programme of works), and full details of a Landscape Management Plan for a minimum period of five years shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in consultation with the Canal and River Trust. These details shall include a detailed scheme for the boundary treatment of and within the site specifying details of the type, position, design, dimensions and materials of the boundary treatment.

The approved works shall be carried out prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, to ensure approprately landscaped amenity space and public realm, and to preserve historic interest of the conservation area,  in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (h) and 1.2 (d)(g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2015) and policies 7.4, 7C and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.
| Details of Measures to Protect Canal from Unwanted Vehicles

No development shall take place until details of the design, appearance and exact location of the proposed bollards, barriers or other measures to prevent vehicles entering the canal have first been submitted to and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall subsequently only be implemented in accordance with the agreed details and the measures shall be installed prior to first occupation of any of the dwellings and thereafter be so retained at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of suitably designed barriers in the interests of safety and to protect users on the canal, the integrity of the canal infrastructure and to prevent a detrimental impact on the appearance of the canal,  in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (h) and 1.2 (d)(g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2015) and policies 7.4, 7C and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.
| Ecological Protection and Management Plan

The development shall be implemented during the construction and operational phases in accordance with the details and mitigation measures contained within the 'Ecological Appraisal' report prepared by ACD Landscape.

Reason:  To ensure that the ecological habitat of the adjacent designated Site of Importance of Nature Conservation is protected and enhanced in accordance with policies 5.3 and 5.4 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012); policy 2.18 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) ; and policies 2.18 and 7.16, 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016).
| Sustainable Urban Drainage Strategy

Notwithstanding any submitted information, prior to commencement of the proposed development (excluding demolition and site clearance) (a) a completed Ealing Council SUDS form and detailed drainage design should be submitted and approved to demonstrate that the development would utilise sustainable urban drainage strategies in line with the Mayor's drainage hierarchy (b) A routine maintenance schedule should be submitted to demonstrate that the proposed surface water management methods will be suitably managed for the lifetime of the development to ensure that there will be no surface water flooding to or from the site up to and including a 1 in 100 year (plus climate change) rainfall event

Reason:  To prevent flooding elsewhere by ensuring that sufficient storage of surface flood water is provided and achieved with appropriate sustainable drainage techniques, in accordance policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012); policy LV 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 5.12 and 5.13 of the London Plan (2015); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Intrusive Contaminated Land Investigation and Remediation Scheme
Prior to the commencement of any works on site (except demolition and site clearance) the following shall be submitted to and subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority:

(a)	An intrusive contaminated land investigation and risk assessment of the site. This shall be carried out in accordance with BS1075:2011+A1:2013 and CR11 guidance to assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site. This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person, and shall assess any contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site.

(b)	A remediation (de-contamination) scheme to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended end use. It shall include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management procedures.  The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.
Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation (de-contamination) scheme part (b)

(c) A verification report that demonstrates the completion of measures identified in the approved contamination remediation scheme shall be produced. The report shall be compiled in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in accordance policy 5.21 of The London Plan, policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and the National Planning Policy Framework.
| Regulation of Hours
The hours of business use for the flexible commercial uses (A1, A2, A3 and B1 Use Classes) hereby approved shall be restricted to the period [0700 - 2300hrs] Monday to Sunday.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties and the prospective residential occupiers of the development in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
| Collections and Deliveries Hours

Deliveries of goods to and waste collections from the flexible commercial use units (A1, A2, A3 and B1 Use Classes) hereby approved shall only take place during the period 0800 - 1800 hrs on Mondays to Saturdays and at no time on Sundays and Public Holidays.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties and the prospective residential occupiers of the development in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
| Noise Mitigation - External Plant and Machinery

The rating noise level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 2014, shall not exceed the existing background sound level, as measured at the nearest sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Noise Mitigation - Sound Insulation of Building Envelope

Details of sound mitigation works  of the building envelope with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided to protect sensitive rooms from external noise and from the flexible commercial uses (A1, A2, A3 and B1 Use Classes) hereby approved, and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development. The details as approved shall be implemented prior to the occupation of the development, and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 1.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Removal of Permitted Development Rights

Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended), the two ground floor commercial units shall only be used for A1, A2, A3 and B1 Use Classes, and not for any other use without prior approval of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure that the Council retains control over the quality and provision of any change of use, to protect the provision of employment uses, and to protect the character of the conservation area and surrounds, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.8 of the London Plan, policies 4B, 7.4 and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Piling Works

No piling shall take place until a piling method statement (detailing the depth and type of piling to be undertaken and the methodology by which such piling will be carried out, including measures to prevent and minimise the potential for damage to subsurface sewerage infrastructure, and the programme for the works) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority in consultation with Thames Water.  Any piling must be undertaken in accordance with the terms of the approved piling method statement.

Reason: The proposed works will be in close proximity to underground sewerage utility infrastructure. Piling has the potential to impact on local underground sewerage utility infrastructure; therefore Thames Water would require that any proposed piling do not pose a pollution risk to controlled waters, water or sewage infrastructure in accordance with policy 5.14 of the London Plan (2015), and policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing (Core) Strategy (2012).
